name: Oasis Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely rooms in beautiful gardens. Outside all is choked travel chaos but in this hotel it felt peaceful. I didn't hear the car/lorry
reviews.title: respite from cairo bustle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A true oasis. Lovely rooms in beautiful gardens, lovely swimming pool, adequate food,
reviews.title: Very good experience
Super nice people and garden , rooms, everything!
reviews.text: pleasant service. Others said they were kept awake by constant horns blaring but we were at the back and slept very well. Outside the gate are horrendous traffic jams etc but we were able to relax inside. Location is excellent for Pyramids.

reviews.title: Oasis Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed there for 2 nights ( one at the beginning and one at the end of our 10day holiday). It is close to the pyramids but far from the city centre. The hotel does however have a free shuttle service that goes into Cairo every few hours which we is perfect to go to the Egyptian museum. The drop off is across the street from the museum. As the pyramids was our main attraction in Cairo the hotel was ideally situated. Especially because we went to see the Sound and Light Show in the evening and I was very glad not to sit in Cairo's traffic more than was necessary.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was really very nice. Clean and spacious rooms with aircon, bath and a decent shower ( in the bath). Everything was in working condition and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was buffet and we really enjoyed it. We stayed in 2 different rooms on the 2 occasions and it was the same every time so I am pretty sure we were not just lucky. I did at some stage realize that I can hear the neighbours quite easily through the walls so I expect that it might be worse in high season. The gardens were beautiful and very well kept. We had dinner in the Italian restaurant on site and is was excellent.
reviews.title: A very nice green space amid the sand

reviews.text: We booked this hotel through Nile Cruise Direct on a 2 night stop over after a nile cruise. As a base to see cairo and the pyramids the location cannot be faulted. The hotel itself has a great pool area, good bar and dining facilities and best of all were the rooms..........chalet type. All the rooms have good amenities and are set in beautiful gardens. Staff and security are excellent.It may not be a 5 star hotel but it certainly acts like one.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: The hotel is more like a holiday camp in layout. Excellent pool, good breakfast and reasonable restaurant. The only other reasons to stay here rather than central Cairo is that the air pollution is not as bad here and the pyramids are just a couple of miles away.
reviews.title: Handy for Pyramids but nothing else.

reviews.text: Outside, the road is busy and there is nothing within a mile or so worth seeing. No shops, nada! The pyramids are a LE10 taxi ride away - just stop one on the road outside. LE100 from the airport in an MPV after an initial offer to take me for LE200. The hotel's taxis are better and not much more expensive.
reviews.title: I liked this hotel
A week 3 star, dated but clean and in good repair
reviews.text: Make sure you bring enough drinking water for your stay (concealed) since they charge four times the going rate.

reviews.title: Oasis hotel in Cairo
reviews.text: we arrived late and tired--the staff did a very good job of getting us settled; particularly the overworked bellman who went out of his way to assist us. the desk staff was very good; the restaurant was good, nice buffet and service good except for one waiter; the bar stunk of cigarette smoke but had good entertainment. Had a large TV to watch the soccer game--beer was cold--☺. Mainly, it was clean and quiet with hot water and comfortable beds. I had read negative reviews and had low expectations, but, honestly, it was a very good hotel. I would stay there again.

The hotel is fantastic. Instead of buiding upwards like many hotels, the Oasis hotel is built outwards into the beautiful gardens. The hotel is built on so much land that I got lost several times trying to find reception !!!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are many places to eat on site, providing great value for money and lovely food. The rooms are very spacious and have their own little patio.
reviews.title: POOR, CHECKED OUT AND WENT TO THE MERIDIEN

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cairo is a chaotic city. The traffic is usually at a stand still making the simplest of journeys take forever. The main reason visitng Cairo is to see the pyramids - there isn't much more to do. For this the Oasis hotel is perfect! It is situated about 3 miles away from the pyramids - the journey should take 10 mins by car although it really depends on the traffic.
reviews.title: Good hotel but far from the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You should be very careful in Egypt - the people are very friendly but this is mainly because they want to sell you something. They start off by asking where you're from... how long are you staying in Egypt/Cairo... which hotel are you staying in, before gently easing their product onto you. The best way to deal with this is to give as little information as possible, or simply ignore them. If you're not interested, don't give them any information about yourself. If you are interested, whatever price they initially quote, they will take half of (usually), so haggle them down!
reviews.title: Absolutely Horrible Experience - Do Not Stay Here

reviews.text: Although they are persistant, you are not in any danger. They are just annoying.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay

reviews.text: We just spent five days at the Oasis Hotel in Cairo, and we found it to be a pleasant alternative to downtown. Close to the Pyramids, it was convenient for reaching Giza early in the morning when crowds were at a minimum. The grounds were lovely, the staff very helpful and the variety of restaurants could meet almost any culinary requirements.
reviews.title: A pleasant respite from the chaos of Cairo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was nice to be able to find a quiet spot away from the traffic and noise of the city, but for someone who wants to explore Cairo it may be too far from the center. There is a free shuttle that goes into the city several times a day, but given the traffic jams that plague the area, that trip can take well over an hour.
reviews.title: Great Hotel-bad service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed sitting in the gardens in the evening, having a glass of wine. We loved sitting by the pool, even if it was too chilly to enjoy a swim. I had a great massage that was both reasonably priced and very relaxing.
reviews.title: Hospitality? Not really.

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was ample, with a nice variety of both typical Egyptian cuisine and cereal and yogurts for the less adventurous. The coffee was undrinkable....opt for the tea instead! We had light meals at the poolside cafe and had dinner one night at the Italian restaurant upstairs. All were acceptable but none were particularly memorable.
reviews.title: Nice pool/food/rooms a great option for low price, far from city, close to pyramids
Good Hotel
reviews.text: All in all, the Oasis offers a good solution to lodging in Cairo.

description: The Oasis Hotel is located minutes away from the Great Giza Pyramids and Sphinx. It is set within 9 acres of magnificently landscaped garden and features rooms overlooking and a breathtaking palm forest decorated with all that Mother Nature has to offer.The Oasis Hotel is an outstanding combination of resort facilities, Luxury hotel guest rooms & suites.
